Description: Rim, wall and foot sherd of black-glazed pottery small bowl with incurving rim and flaring convex foot; wholly glazed.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Akademisches Kunstmuseum. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
See Rotroff, Agora XXIX nos. 979-985 fig. 62, pl. 75 For the shape, compare Sparkes, Agora XII no. 943 (salt cellar, dated 475 BC - 350 BC).
Bibliographic references: Piekarski 2001 / Die Keramik aus Naukratis im Akademischen Kunstmuseum Bonn (p. 47, no. D12, pl. 20, no. 4)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (ID.022)
